com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FButton, FCalendar, FChart, FCheckBox, FCKEditor, FComboBox, FContainer, FDatePicker, FDropdownMenu, FDropdownMenu2, FErrorMessage, FExtender, FGauge, FHTML, FHtmlString, FLabel, FLabel2, FLink, FMap, FModalPopup, FSyntaxHighlighter, FTabPane, FTextArea, FTextDiff, FTextField, FTimeline, FUpload, PivotControl, Popup, Timeplot, ToolTip, ToolTip2

    public abstract class FComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements FEventListener
    The basic, abstract UI component.
    Author:
    uli

      When TRUE client updates will be triggered through a "parent.location.reload();" refresh of the parent

      • htmlAnchor

        public XMLBuilder.Element htmlAnchor()
        a component can choose to create its anchor HTML div, span, etc.. tag via this call. If it does, it can be used in a FContainer. This call may ONLY return a single (i.e. non nested) Element. Inner values are provided by render()

      • populateView

        public void populateView()
        Populates (redraws) this component's view.

      • populateView

        public void populateView(FClientUpdate.Prio priority)
        Specifying the priority is usually not required. Only when the rendering of the anchor and the population happen on the same response.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority that will be assigned to the FClientUpdates.
        See Also:
        populateView()

      • populateViewAndCallback

        public void populateViewAndCallback(java.lang.String callbackFunction,
                           boolean forceCallback)
        Populates (redraws) the view and initiates java script callback (if update is available OR forceCallback)
        Parameters:
        callbackFunction -
        forceCallback - if true, callback is even initiated if no update available

              FClientUpdate.Prio prio)
        Adds a clientUpdate with plain javascript callback to the queue,
        Parameters:
        callbackFunction -
        prio - - the priority: use Prio.veryEnd for some callbacks that can only be executed in the end

      • getContextPath

        public java.lang.String getContextPath()
        can be used if you are in some component to get the browsers context path (usually for building urls, adding pictures, ...)
        for SAP this is /sap
        for IFS this is /ifs
        for SES this is /ses
        Returns:
        the current context path needs the page's request to be set
        See Also:
        FPage.request

      • setHidden

        public void setHidden(boolean flag)
        hides the element by assigning/removing the 'hidden' class name Note: does not populate the component, for that use hide(boolean)
        Parameters:
        flag - if true hides if false displays

      • hide

        public void hide(boolean flag)
        Hides the element by assigning/removing the 'hidden' class name, then populates its state.

        To simply set a component to hidden, without also triggering a populateView() (for example during rendering), see setHidden(boolean)
        Parameters:
        flag - if true hides if false displays

      • toggleSlow

        public void toggleSlow()
        slides current element

      • toggleSlow

        public void toggleSlow(int millis)
        slides current element
        Parameters:
        millis, - total slide time in milliseconds, default 50

      • requestFocus

        public void requestFocus()
        Sends an FClientUpdate which requests focus on the current component. May not work with nonstandard HTML components. Should be called on the respective page's FPage.onPageLoad(HttpServletRequest). It only makes sense to call this method on a single FComponent per page.

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()

      • getComponentid

        public java.lang.String getComponentid()
        Returns:
        inner component id (= FComponent ID). Used for updating the component's value from the backend. Different than getId().

        public void startPolling(java.lang.Long pollingRateInMs)
        Parameters:

      • startPolling

        public void startPolling(java.lang.Long pollingRateInMs,
                java.lang.String argument)
        starts polling
        Parameters:
        compId - - component id (where the timeoutVariable is stored)
        id - - component id for callback
        pollingRateInMs - - polling frequency in ms
        argument - - argument, which is passed along, can be null. argument must be a valid JS expression that returns a string

      • startPolling

        public void startPolling(java.lang.Long pollingRateInMs,
                java.lang.String argument,
                java.lang.Runnable pollAction)
        starts polling and registers a custom action that is executed onPoll()
        Parameters:
        pollingRateInMs - - polling frequency in ms
        argument - - argument, which is passed along, can be null. argument must be a valid JS expression that returns a string

      • isPollingStarted

        public boolean isPollingStarted()

      • cssURLs

        public java.lang.String[] cssURLs()
        a component might need some CSS / JavaScript in the HTML head to function (example: GMap)
        Returns:
        null if nothing is needed, the css source URL otherwise

      • jsURLs

        public java.lang.String[] jsURLs()
        a component might need some CSS / JavaScript in the HTML head to function (example: GMap)
        Returns:
        null if nothing is needed, the javascript source URL otherwise
